member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern
member.summary: Class which holds a single 2D symbol pattern used for decoding a symbol within an image. Provides access to the training parameters, a method to train the pattern, results of training the pattern, and a method to execute a find and decode operation.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes and the pattern is not trained.

Fires when the value of this property changes and the pattern is trained.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: Sets or gets the nominal grid.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the nominal grid which defines the dimensions and orientation of the symbol's finder pattern.
If the is TypicalSymbols this parameter is always learned during , so setting this property has no effect.
If the is HighlyDegradedSymbols you can set the NominalGrid flag with to have the tool learn the nominal grid. This is often more accurate than specifying the nominal grid yourself.

For Data Matrix symbols, the nominal grid should enclose the finder pattern of the symbol; its coordinate system should be a right-handed system with the origin in the lower left corner. For QR symbols, the nominal grid should overlay the center of the finder pattern; its coordinate system should be a rotated left-handed system with the origin in the upper right corner.

exception.para: The affine rectangle was NULL.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern.TrainTimeout

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the maximum time in milliseconds allowed for training. The timeout period is used only when is True.
If the tool has not finished training the symbol by the end of this timeout period, it will stop and return e_Cog_TimeoutExpired.
remarks.NOTE: Due to internal latencies, this timeout value is an approximate upper limit. The actual execution time can exceed the timeout value by up to 20 milliseconds on a 200 MHz Pentium I. Latencies on faster CPUs are typically lower.

member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum execution time (msec) allowed to train.

exception.para: The timeout period is less than zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern.NonConformantModulesEnabled

event.para: Fires when the property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Sets or gets whether to consider non-confirming modules when training the pattern.

remarks.para: Ideally, a 2D symbol is made up of square or round modules of a uniform color. However when the symbol is dot-peened on a metal surface, the module may appear as an annulus whose center is the inverse of the color expected. Depending on the physical depth of the dots and the lighting of the metal surface, the appearance of the annulus can cause conventional decoding algorithms to fail. When this property is enabled, the tool takes extra processing steps to train these kinds of symbols.

This property is respected only when the
is DataMatrix.

Enabling this property may increase the amount of time needed to train or decode degraded symbols even if the image has no distortion. For best performance, enable this property only when you know that the the symbol image has modules that appear as annuli.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern.PerspectiveEnabled

event.para: Fires when the property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Sets or gets whether to consider perspective distortion for symbol training.

remarks.para: When this property is True, you can train and decode symbols that show perspective distortion.

Enabling this property may increase the amount of time needed to train or decode degraded symbols even if the image has no distortion. For best performance, enable this property only when you know that the the symbol image has perspective distortion.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the Code Page (character set) used to generate the property in the object after the pattern or running the tool.

Applications whose data consists of ASCII characters should use the ANSILatin1, ANSI (Latin 1) Code Page, setting which corresponds to the ISO 8859-1 character set. QR symbols that encode Japanese characters should use Japanese.

PARA.NOTE: Although provides constants for ANSI and Japanese character sets, you can use any code page that Windows supports.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern.OperatingMode

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the operating mode that will be used to train and decode images.

Always try to use the Typical Symbols (TypicalSymbols) operating mode first. Use the Highly Degraded Symbols (HighlyDegradedSymbols) operating mode only if you cannot use the Typical Symbols operating mode. When you use the Typical Symbols operating mode, the tool learns the best values for all the training parameters. In the Highly Degraded Symbols operating mode, you can have the tool learn some of the parameters, but you must specify the others.
When the operating mode is HighlyDegradedSymbols and is None, the tool assumes that all of the parameters are correct and immediately enters the state.

member.summary: Sets or gets the operating mode that will be used to train and decode images.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolPattern.Train

remarks.PARA: Trains this 2D Symbol pattern. If the pattern is already trained then it will be untrained and retrained.
If the training was successful, is True and the tool generates a object that contains the training parameters that were learned (if you were in the Typical Symbols operating mode).
If you were in in Highly Degraded Symbols operating mode, the training parameters are determined as follows:
If is , then the specified parameters are used in training. If the training image can be decoded using the supplied parameters, is set to true.

If is set to anything other than , then the pattern attempts to learn all of the parameters (including the ones that you supply). If the training image can be decoded using the learned parameters, then is set to true. If the training image cannot be decoded, the tool attempts to learn only the parameters that you specify to be learned, then uses those learned parameters plus the parameters that you supply. If the training image can be decoded using this combination of learned and supplied parameters, then is set to true.
See for additional information about learning training parameters.
The object also includes the typical results of finding and decoding a symbol.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolRunParams.NonConformantModulesMode
member.summary: Sets or gets Sets or gets whether to consider non-confirming modules when decoding images.

event.para: Fires when the property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.para: Ideally, a 2D symbol is made up of square or round modules of a uniform color. However when the symbol is dot-peened on a metal surface, the module may appear as an annulus whose center is the inverse of the color expected. Depending on the physical depth of the dots and the lighting of the metal surface, the appearance of the annulus can cause conventional decoding algorithms to fail. When this property is set to Enabled or to UsePattern and the pattern was trained for non-conforming modules the tool takes extra processing steps to decode these kinds of symbols.

This property is respected only when the
is DataMatrix.

Enabling this property may increase the amount of time needed to decode degraded symbols even if the image has no distortion. For best performance, enable this property only when you know that the the symbol image has modules that appear as annuli.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolRunParams.PerspectiveMode
member.summary: Sets or gets whether to consider perspective distortion when decoding images.

event.para: Fires when the property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.para: When this property is True, you can decode symbols that show perspective distortion.
When this property is set to Enabled or to UsePattern and the pattern was trained for symbols with perspective distortion the tool takes extra processing steps to decode these kinds of symbols.

Enabling this property may increase the amount of time needed to decode degraded symbols even if the image has no distortion. For best performance, enable this property only when you know that the the symbol image has perspective distortion.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolRunParams.Timeout

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds that the tool is allowed to decode a symbol. The timeout period is used only when is True.
If the tool has not finished decoding the symbol by the end of this timeout period, it will stop and return e_Cog_TimeoutExpired.
remarks.NOTE: Due to internal latencies, this timeout value is an approximate upper limit. The actual execution time can exceed the timeout value by up to 20 milliseconds on a 200 MHz Pentium I. Latencies on faster CPUs are typically lower.

member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum amount of execution time allowed to decode a symbol.

exception.para: The timeout value is less than zero.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Returns/sets the flag that designates that the operation should be used to decode the symbol. This allows the tool to automatically learn new symbol properties for each new symbol on which it is run. When this flag is true and the tool is run, the pattern's method will be called using the as the pattern's train region. The produced will be passed on as the of the tool. This should be used when symbol properties vary between runs.

member.summary: Runs the tool using the current parameter settings.

event.para: Fires before the tool runs.

Fires when the tool runs. If the run was successful, results are generated; if the run was not successful, no results are generated and the previous results are cleared. Use after returns or in a
event handler to determine whether a run was successful or unsuccessful.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.UnusedErrorCorrection
member.summary: AIM unused error correction. The higher the unused error correction capacity, the better the symbol quality. Ranges from 0 (all error correction capacity used) to 1.0 (no error correction capacity used).

remarks.PARA: AIM unused error correction. The higher the unused error correction capacity, the better the symbol quality. Ranges from 0 (all error correction capacity used) to 1.0 (no error correction capacity used).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.UnusedErrorCorrectionGrade

remarks.PARA: AIM unused error correction grade. The greater the unused error correction capacity, the better the grade. A (almost all capacity is unused), B, C, D, or F (all, or almost all capacity is used).

member.summary: AIM unused error correction grade. The greater the unused error correction capacity, the better the grade. A (almost all capacity is unused), B, C, D, or F (all, or almost all capacity is used).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.AxialNonuniformity
member.summary: AIM axial nonuniformity. This is a measure of how much the sampling point spacing differs between the X and Y axes. A value of 0 means there is no difference.

remarks.PARA: The AIM axial nonuniformity, which is a measure of how much the sampling point spacing differs between the X and Y axes. A value of 0 indicates there is no difference.
AIM Inc. defines axial nonuniformity as:
abs(Xavg - Yavg) / ((Xavg + Yavg) / 2)

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.AxialNonuniformityGrade

remarks.PARA: The AIM axial nonuniformity grade, which is a measure of how much the sampling point spacing differs from one axis to another. Based upon the axial nonuniformity, this grade is assigned as:

member.summary: AIM axial nonuniformity grade. This is a measure of how much the sampling point spacing differs from one axis to another. A (negligible), B, C, D, or F (excessive).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.PrintGrowthVertical

remarks.PARA: This is the AIM print growth in the vertical direction. It is computed by summing the dark pixels (ND) and the light pixels (NL) along a vertical sample line. For Data Matrix symbols this sample line runs through the center of the right-most column. For QR Code symbols this sample line runs along the timing patterns. The result is computed as ND / (ND + NL).

member.summary: AIM normalized print growth in vertical direction. Ranges from -1 to 1, with a nominal value of 0.0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.PrintGrowthHorizontal
member.summary: AIM normalized print growth in horizontal direction. Ranges from -1 to 1, with a nominal value of 0.0.

remarks.PARA: This is the AIM print growth in the horizontal direction. It is computed by summing the dark pixels (ND) and the light pixels (NL) along a horizontal sample line. For Data Matrix symbols this sample line runs through the center of the top row. For QR Code symbols this sample line runs along the timing patterns. The result is computed as ND / (ND + NL).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.PrintGrowthGrade
member.summary: AIM print growth grade. A (negligible deviation from nominal), B, C, D, or F (excessive deviation from nominal).

remarks.PARA: The AIM print growth grade. Grades A, B, C, D, or F are assigned as follows:
For each direction (horizontal, vertical), compute normalized growth as:
Growth grade for this direction is then:
The reported print growth grade is the lower (worse) of the two.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.SymbolContrast
member.summary: AIM symbol contrast. Range is 0.0 (no contrast) to 1.0 (full contrast).

remarks.PARA: The AIM symbol contrast grade, which indicates the difference in reflectance between the light and dark elements of the symbol, including the quiet zone. The higher the contrast difference, the higher the grade.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolVerifyAIMResult.SymbolContrastGrade

remarks.PARA: AIM symbol contrast grade. A: >= .7, B: >= .55, C: >= .4, D: >= .2, F: < .2 symbol contrast.

member.summary: AIM symbol contrast grade. A: >= .7, B: >= .55, C: >= .4, D: >= .2, F: < .2 symbol contrast.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.CogPDF417.Timeout

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the maximum execution time in milliseconds that the tool is allowed to run. The timeout period is used only when is True.
If the tool has not finished decoding the symbol by the end of this timeout period, it will stop and return e_Cog_TimeoutExpired.
remarks.NOTE: Due to internal latencies, this timeout value is an approximate upper limit. The actual execution time can exceed the timeout value by up to 20 milliseconds on a 200 MHz Pentium I. Latencies on faster CPUs are typically lower.

member.summary: Returns/sets the maximum execution time (msec) allowed to execute. If the decode has not finished by the end of the timeout period, it will stop soon thereafter and return E_Cog_TimeoutExpired. This value only applies if TimeoutEnabled is true.

exception.para: The timeout value is less than zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.CogPDF417.TimeoutEnabled

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets whether to use the property that limits the execution time of the tool. If is False, timeout is disabled and the property is ignored.

member.summary: Returns the number of data columns in the data region of the decoded symbol. In each row of a PDF417 symbol, between left and right row indicators, there may be from 1 to 30 data codewords. The returned value ranges from 1 to 30.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.CogPDF417Result.Rows

exception.para: The symbol was not decoded ( is False).

member.summary: Returns the number of data rows in the data region of the decoded symbol. A row is a lateral set of elements made up of a start pattern, codewords, and a stop pattern. The returned value ranges from 3 to 90.

remarks.PARA: Returns the number of data rows in the data region of the decoded symbol. A row is an horizontal set of elements made up of a left row indicator, a set of data codewords, and a right row indicator. The returned value ranges from 3 to 90.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.CogPDF417Result.Decoded

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.TwoDSymbol.Cog2DSymbolSymbologyConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of 2D Symbol symbologies.

remarks.PARA: Enumeration of 2D Symbol symbologies used by .
QR Code (Quick Response Code) is a two-dimensional matrix symbology that has finder patterns on three of its corners.
The MicroQR code is a smaller version of QR Code that uses only one finder pattern.
Use to set the specific QR Code model.

Data Matrix is a 2D symbology that features a rectangular or square array of dark and white modules used to encode data. The symbol has a finder pattern, which is used to locate and orient the symbol. This pattern consists of a vertical and horizontal bar that is one module wide on the left and bottom sides of the symbol and alternate dark and light modules on the right and top
